description: The noun is derived from the verb.

entries.meaning: An act of spending time idly and unfruitfully; a dawdling.
An act of moving or walking lackadaisically, a dawdling; a leisurely or slow walk or other journey.
Synonym of dawdler (“a person who dawdles or idles”)

verbs.description: dawdle (third-person singular simple present dawdles, present participle dawdling, simple past and past participle dawdled)

entries.meaning: (transitive) Chiefly followed by away: to spend (time) without haste or purpose. [from late 18th c.]
examples: to dawdle away the whole morning

entries.meaning: To spend time idly and unfruitfully; to waste time. [from mid 17th c. (probably dialectal); in general use from late 18th c.]
examples: Synonyms: dally, dilly-dally, take one's time; see also Thesaurus:loiter
If you dawdle on your daily walk, you won’t get as much exercise.

entries.meaning: Alternative spelling of doddle (“a job, task, or other activity that is easy to complete or simple”)
